params.snMessaging: The address of Starknet Core contract, responsible or messaging.

consumeMessage(uint256,uint256[]).details: A message "receive" means that the message hash is registered as consumable. One must provide the message content, to let Starknet Core contract verify the hash and validate the message content before being consumed.

params.fromAddress: L2 contract (account) that has sent the message.
params.payload: Payload of the message used to verify the hash.

sendMessage(uint256,uint256,uint256[]).details: Consider that Cairo only understands felts252. So the serialization on solidity must be adjusted. For instance, a uint256 must be split in two uint256 with low and high part to be understood by Cairo.

params.payload: The serialized data to be sent.
params.selector: The l1_handler function of the contract to call.

consumeMessage(uint256,uint256[]).notice: Manually consumes a message that was received from L2.

consumeMessageStruct(uint256,uint256[]).notice: Example of consuming a serialized struct from L2.

consumeMessageValue(uint256,uint256[]).notice: Example of consuming a value received from L2.

sendMessage(uint256,uint256,uint256[]).notice: Sends a message to Starknet contract.

sendMessageValue(uint256,uint256,uint256.notice: A simple function that sends a message with a pre-determined payload.

documentation.text: @notice A simple function that sends a message with a pre-determined payload.
@notice Example of consuming a value received from L2.
@notice Example of consuming a serialized struct from L2.
@title Test contract to receive / send messages to starknet.
